meanings.definition: A generation that is a subdivision of a larger generation.
meanings.sent1: In our family, the subgeneration of cousins always has a fun time together.
meanings.sent2: The subgeneration of students born in the same year formed a close bond.
meanings.sent3: The subgeneration of puppies in the litter played together joyfully.
meanings.sent4: The subgeneration of stars in the galaxy sparkled brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The subgeneration of flowers in the garden added a burst of color to the landscape.

meanings.definition: The act or process of producing a new generation that is a subset of a larger group.
meanings.sent1: The subgeneration of ideas led to innovative solutions in the project.
meanings.sent2: The subgeneration of technology advancements revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent3: The subgeneration of jokes at the party kept everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The subgeneration of melodies in the song created a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent5: The subgeneration of waves in the ocean crashed against the shore with power.
